name: Solomon Linda's Original Evening Birds
description: '''Solomon Linda's Original Evening Birds''' was a South African vocal group formed by [[Solomon Linda]] in 1933. The band is known internationally for their song "[[Mbube (song)|Mbube]]" released in 1939, which is the origin of the pop song "[[The Lion Sleeps Tonight]]". During their activity, they often took part in singing competitions, in which they were unbeatable, according to historian Veit Erlmann. The group disbanded in 1948.{{Reference page|page=68}} They are the pioneers of the musical genres [[Mbube (genre)|Mbube]] and [[Isicathamiya]].
